segment.source: Interactive logon Smart card removal behavior (Windows 10)
segment.target: Interactive logon Smart card removal behavior (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Interactive logon Smart card removal behavior security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Interactive logon Smart card removal behavior security policy setting.

segment.source: Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior
segment.target: Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines what happens when the smart card for a logged-on user is removed from the smart card reader.
segment.target: This policy setting determines what happens when the smart card for a logged-on user is removed from the smart card reader.

segment.source: If smart cards are used for authentication, the device should automatically lock itself when the card is removed—that way, if users forget to manually lock their devices when they are away from them, malicious users cannot gain access.
segment.target: If smart cards are used for authentication, the device should automatically lock itself when the card is removed—that way, if users forget to manually lock their devices when they are away from them, malicious users cannot gain access.

segment.source: If you select Force Logoff in the property sheet for this policy setting, the user is automatically logged off when the smart card is removed.
segment.target: If you select Force Logoff in the property sheet for this policy setting, the user is automatically logged off when the smart card is removed.

segment.source: Users will have to reinsert their smart cards and reenter their PINs when they return to their workstations.
segment.target: Users will have to reinsert their smart cards and reenter their PINs when they return to their workstations.

segment.source: If you select this, the workstation is locked when the smart card is removed, allowing users to leave the area, take their smart card with them, and still maintain a protected session.
segment.target: If you select this, the workstation is locked when the smart card is removed, allowing users to leave the area, take their smart card with them, and still maintain a protected session.

segment.source: If you select this, the user is automatically logged off when the smart card is removed.
segment.target: If you select this, the user is automatically logged off when the smart card is removed.

segment.source: Disconnect if a remote Remote Desktop Services session
segment.target: Disconnect if a remote Remote Desktop Services session

segment.source: If you select this, removal of the smart card disconnects the session without logging the user off.
segment.target: If you select this, removal of the smart card disconnects the session without logging the user off.

segment.source: This allows the user to insert the smart card and resume the session later, or at another smart card reader-equipped computer, without having to log on again.
segment.target: This allows the user to insert the smart card and resume the session later, or at another smart card reader-equipped computer, without having to log on again.

segment.source: If the session is local, this policy functions identically to Lock Workstation.
segment.target: If the session is local, this policy functions identically to Lock Workstation.

segment.source: Set Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior to Lock Workstation.
segment.target: Set Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior to Lock Workstation.

segment.source: If you select Lock Workstation in the property sheet for this policy setting, the workstation is locked when the smart card is removed.
segment.target: If you select Lock Workstation in the property sheet for this policy setting, the workstation is locked when the smart card is removed.

segment.source: This allows users to leave the area, take their smart card with them, and still maintain a protected session.
segment.target: This allows users to leave the area, take their smart card with them, and still maintain a protected session.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: This policy setting can be configured by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to be distributed through Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: This policy setting can be configured by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) to be distributed through Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: If this policy is not contained in a distributed GPO, this policy can be configured on the local computer by using the Local Security Policy snap-in.
segment.target: If this policy is not contained in a distributed GPO, this policy can be configured on the local computer by using the Local Security Policy snap-in.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Users sometimes forget to lock their workstations when they are away from them, allowing the possibility for malicious users to access their devices.
segment.target: Users sometimes forget to lock their workstations when they are away from them, allowing the possibility for malicious users to access their devices.

segment.source: If smart cards are used for authentication, the device should automatically lock itself when the card is removed to ensure that only the user with the smart card is accessing resources by using those credentials.
segment.target: If smart cards are used for authentication, the device should automatically lock itself when the card is removed to ensure that only the user with the smart card is accessing resources by using those credentials.

segment.source: Configure the Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior setting to Lock Workstation.
segment.target: Configure the Interactive logon: Smart card removal behavior setting to Lock Workstation.

segment.source: If you select Lock Workstation for this policy setting, the device locks when the smart card is removed.
segment.target: If you select Lock Workstation for this policy setting, the device locks when the smart card is removed.

segment.source: Users can leave the area, take their smart card with them, and still maintain a protected session.
segment.target: Users can leave the area, take their smart card with them, and still maintain a protected session.

segment.source: This behavior is similar to the setting that requires users to log on when resuming work on the device after the screen saver has started.
segment.target: This behavior is similar to the setting that requires users to log on when resuming work on the device after the screen saver has started.

segment.source: If you select Force Logoff for this policy setting, the user is automatically logged off when the smart card is removed.
segment.target: If you select Force Logoff for this policy setting, the user is automatically logged off when the smart card is removed.

segment.source: This setting is useful when a device is deployed as a public access point, such as a kiosk or other type of shared device
segment.target: This setting is useful when a device is deployed as a public access point, such as a kiosk or other type of shared device

segment.source: If you select Force Logoff, users must insert their smart cards and enter their PINs when they return to their workstations.
segment.target: If you select Force Logoff, users must insert their smart cards and enter their PINs when they return to their workstations.
